bestBHT.bht: Witnesses of the miraculous healing recounted the details to others, providing double confirmation of the possessed man's transformation. The testimony came from both the herdsmen and the individuals who witnessed the event firsthand. They described how Jesus commanded the unclean spirit to leave the man and how he was freed from a legion of demons merely by the power of Christ's word. The witnesses also explained that, at the request of the demons, they entered the nearby swine, causing the animals to become frenzied and plunge into the sea, where they drowned.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: And they that saw it told them how it befell to him that was possessed with the devil.
Thus had they the double testimony of the herdsmen and their own senses.
The double testimony of the herdsmen and their own senses.
Philip Schaff: And they that saw it... the way in which the cure had occurred.
Probably the swine herds who had returned... those who had accompanied our Lord in the boat.
John Gill: And they that saw it, told them how it befell to him that was possessed with the devil.
...how Christ ordered the unclean spirit to come out of him; and how he was dispossessed of a legion of devils by a word speaking.

...how, at the request of the devils, and by the leave of Christ, they entered into them; upon which they ran mad; and betaking themselves to the rocks by the sea side, fell down the precipice, and were suffocated in the sea.

bhtAttempts.bht: Witnesses of the miraculous healing recounted the details to others, providing double confirmation of the possessed man's transformation. The testimony came from both the herdsmen and the individuals who witnessed the event firsthand. They described how Jesus commanded the unclean spirit to leave the man and how he was freed from a legion of demons merely by the power of Christ's word. The witnesses also explained that, at the request of the demons, they entered the nearby swine, causing the animals to become frenzied and plunge into the sea, where they drowned.

Those who observed the astonishing healing shared the account with others, which provided a dual testimony to validate the man's deliverance from demon possession. The witnesses conveyed how Jesus commanded the unclean spirit to depart from the man, resulting in his liberation from a horde of demons by a mere spoken word. Furthermore, they detailed that, upon their request, the demons entered a nearby herd of swine, causing them to run berserk and ultimately perish in the sea.

Those who witnessed the event recounted the marvelous occurrence to others, sharing the remarkable details of the possessed man's encounter with Jesus. Their testimony served as a double confirmation of the miraculous healing, providing both the perspective of the herdsmen and their own personal observations. They described how Jesus commanded the unclean spirit to leave the man, freeing him from a legion of demons with just a word. The witnesses also explained that, at the request of the demons, they entered a herd of swine, causing them to go mad and plunge into the sea.

Those who saw what had happened shared the details of the possessed man's deliverance with others, providing an undeniable testimony of the miraculous event. Both the herdsman and eyewitnesses attested to the extraordinary transformation they witnessed. They recounted how Jesus commanded the unclean spirit to leave the man, resulting in his liberation from a multitude of demonic forces with a single word. Furthermore, they noted that, at the demons' request, they entered a nearby herd of swine, causing the animals to go mad and perish in the sea.

Those who witnessed the possessed man's healing relayed the account to others, offering a dual testimony from both the herdsmen and their own firsthand experiences. They described how Jesus commanded the unclean spirit to depart, allowing the man to be freed from a legion of demons by a simple word. Additionally, they reported that, upon the demons' request and with Jesus' permission, they entered into a herd of swine. As a result, the swine became wild and drowned in the sea.
